comments.body: I opted to leave this loose for now due to the size of the IdentityInfo object and lack of documentation in jsforce docs.
For reference, here’s article about the identity endpoint https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=remoteaccess_using_openid.htm&type=5&sfdcIFrameOrigin=null
Thanks @douglascayers. I guess my only question is if typing this out is necessary for this PR to go in? Or something that can be done in a follow up PR.

@sacummings91 I think it's worth while to finish up the typings since we already have a PR in flight. I've prepared [this branch](https://github.com/douglascayers/DefinitelyTyped/tree/pr-43448-jsforce-types) that includes your changes plus the identity properties.

If you don't mind, please merge my branch into yours then push back up. Thanks!

_To merge my changes into your branch:_
```
git remote add douglascayers https://github.com/douglascayers/DefinitelyTyped.git
git fetch douglascayers
git merge douglascayers pr-43448-jsforce-types
git push
```
Hey @douglascayers. I went ahead and merged your changes into my branch. Also, thank you for going ahead and doing that. I appreciate it.
No problem @douglascayers. What steps from here do we need to get this PR in?

We’re waiting on one of the other approves to take action or for the Typescript team to engage. I think we are still in the waiting period per https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/43448#issuecomment-605507026
